snippet: A report of bacterial contamination found in packaged raw chicken products has ignited a debate over potential health threats in poultry.
abstract: Study by the Physicians Committee for Responsible Medicine shows that roughly half of the packaged raw chicken products bought at grocery stores across the country are contaminated with the bacteria E coli.
lead_paragraph: A report of bacterial contamination found in packaged raw chicken products has ignited a debate over potential health threats in poultry.

headline.seo: In Small Sample, E. Coli Found in 48% of Chicken in Stores
headline.main: 48% of Chicken in Small Sample Has E. Coli
headline.print_headline: 48% of Chicken in Small Sample Has E. Coli
